channel.title: New speakers (suggestions)
channel.description:
I don't know much about speakers+amps, and I've only ever bought £20-£80 all-in-one systems (ie, my last system was this: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Philips-SPA2600-channel-Multimedia-Speaker/dp/B000JHZWUC and was fairly good for what I needed, but they're already wearing out and becoming shit)
I have a £200 budget (£250 max) and they need to be decent quality at (very) high volume. I'll be using them for parties at uni and just general music/gaming stuff. They also have to look nice!
I've read a lot of good reviews on the Bose Companion 3 Series (http://store.apple.com/uk/product/TK201B/B?fnode=MTY1NDA0MA&mco=MTg4MzcxNjY), opinions?!

item.title: New speakers (suggestions)
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“lawl_temp, post:26, topic:403326”]there is nothing better for the price (~$300) than these: http://paradigm.com/products/products-by-category/bookshelf/paradigm/monitor-series/atom-monitor[/quote]Doesnt make Cerwin Vega less of a quality brand.

http://www.shopcerwinvega.com/detail/CER+VE-15/VE-15 - I suppose that would be the equivalent in terms of price.

Tho, i wouldnt buy small speakers, big speakers are perfect as a piece of furniture!

Read full topic

item.title: New speakers (suggestions)
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“lawl_temp, post:24, topic:403326”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=500379.msg3665395#msg3665395 date=1310589033]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=500379.msg3664827#msg3664827 date=1310564686]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=500379.msg3663852#msg3663852 date=1310504914]

i o_O’d a bit when mopar said don’t buy bose they overcharge for what they are and then recommended creative

Hasn’t Bose always been far over and above creative speakers price-wise?
[/quote]You have to take into consideration quality, not just price. Creative has horrible sound for the price tag. Not too different from Logitech.

They are pretty cheap speakers with a pretty good sound from my experience, where as Bose has supposedly good speakers, but for like 8 times the price. It again, like with TVs, boils down to what media you will be playing, and chances are, at a party, you will be playing MP3s, you don’t need really good speakers for those.
[/quote]True, most people would. For myself it’s always vinyls if i have a party at my place.

If you want loud for parties get a pair of used cerwin vegas and a decent enough receiver to power them.

if you want loud AND quality, get paradigms !!
[/quote]Implying Cerwin Vega isn’t quality

correct[/quote]ITT: Trolls or lack of knowledge.

Read full topic

It again, like with TVs, boils down to what media you will be playing, and chances are, at a party, you will be playing MP3s, you don’t need really good speakers for those.

If you want loud for parties get a pair of used cerwin vegas and a decent enough receiver to power them.

item.title: New speakers (suggestions)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:15, topic:403326”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=500379.msg3661660#msg3661660 date=1310395789]

i o_O’d a bit when mopar said don’t buy bose they overcharge for what they are and then recommended creative

Hasn’t Bose always been far over and above creative speakers price-wise?
[/quote]You have to take into consideration quality, not just price. Creative has horrible sound for the price tag. Not too different from Logitech.[/quote]
They are pretty cheap speakers with a pretty good sound from my experience, where as Bose has supposedly good speakers, but for like 8 times the price. It again, like with TVs, boils down to what media you will be playing, and chances are, at a party, you will be playing MP3s, you don’t need really good speakers for those.

Read full topic

when buying speakers you need to make sure the amp is decent as that is usually the bottleneck in the quality of the sound.

item.title: New speakers (suggestions)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Without even looking at them, Bose is always overpriced for what they do. The last set of speakers for a computer I bought was a 7.1 surround Creative system for something like $180ish, about 4-5 years ago, and they are still working great, and are super-loud. I point 2 (out of 7) out of my upstairs window at about half volume and we can hear them perfectly in the back yard about 100 yards away.

I just read through all the reviews on the bose, and everyone seems to love them and say they’re very good value (even considering bose are usually overpriced)… but this could just be fanboyism. Are your Creative speakers similar in spec to my old 5.1 ones I posted (apart from the fact it’s 7.1 rather than 5.1)? I don’t really have space for a load of speakers, and the bose seem perfect because they’re only 2.1 and apparently quite good. Do you know of any products similar to the bose?

[quote=“Niall, post:3, topic:403326”]http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B003ZXDOMA/ref=s9_simh_gw_p23_d3_i1?pf_rd_m=A3P5ROKL5A1OLE&pf_rd_s=center-3&pf_rd_r=1CGBFG8BSQ3P6HNDHP90&pf_rd_t=101&pf_rd_p=467128473&pf_rd_i=468294

£120 give or take, I’ve only ever listened to them on half volume which is pretty fucking loud but they sound great, and the bass is excellent even when it’s only turned to half[/quote]
I saw them on the apple website but didn’t consider them because they look horrible. Do they look better irl? I think I’ll try to listen to them in the apple store or something, because they’re like half the price of the bose and the reviews seem okay.

Read full topic

item.title: New speakers (suggestions)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

amazon.co.uk

Harman Kardon Soundsticks III LED Desktop Wired Speaker System - Transparent: Amazon.co.uk: Hi-Fi & Speakers

Harman Kardon Soundsticks III LED Desktop Wired Speaker System - Transparent.

£120 give or take, I’ve only ever listened to them on half volume which is pretty fucking loud but they sound great, and the bass is excellent even when it’s only turned to half
